content:
Yes, Toyota has developed several new technologies in recent years that have improved the reliability, safety, and efficiency of its vehicles. Some notable ones include:

1. Hybrid powertrains: Toyota is a pioneer in hybrid technology and has introduced several hybrid vehicle models to market including the Prius, Corolla Hybrid, RAV4 Hybrid, and Highlander Hybrid.

2. Direct Shift-CVT: Toyota's new Direct Shift-CVT transmission is designed to provide a direct driving feel while improving fuel efficiency.

3. Dynamic Force Engines: These new engines are designed to provide better fuel economy, lower emissions, and more power than Toyota's previous engines.

4. Toyota Safety Sense: This suite of advanced safety features includes technologies such as pre-collision warning, automatic emergency braking, and lane departure warning. Toyota Safety Sense is standard on most new Toyota vehicles.

5. Fuel Cell Vehicles: Toyota is also a leader in fuel cell technology and has introduced the Mirai as a fuel cell electric vehicle.

6. Autonomous driving: Toyota is investing in autonomous driving technologies through partnerships with companies such as Uber and Pony.ai to develop self-driving vehicles.

These are just some of the technologies that Toyota has developed in recent years. Toyota continues to invest in new technologies to improve the quality, reliability, and safety of its vehicles.
